nodes.bodyText: V1 is replaced with V2. Will do the clean up as a separate PR
This is the DocIdSetPlanNode.MAX_DOC_PER_CALL, replaced it with the constant

Would it be better to use explicit values instead of random?
For example, we know all the corner cases would be around bits being split across read boundaries. We can then programmatically generate all the splits. Given this is a fundamental change, I'd feel more comfortable with exhaustive testing on all corner cases explicitly tested.

That's why I explicitly tested reading the last doc ids (_lastSequentialDocIds).
Modified the test to test sequentialDocId starting from 0 - 31
should we use some cached int arrays here?
This is a very small array and the overhead is negligible. We create the buffer per block (10000 docs) only when bulk read is needed
How is this covering all the numbits cases for new APIs?
We should add tests for new APIs for all numbits right?
This is just the random value generator. All the bits are tested. Check the for look on line 55
We should add tests for all numBits and all possible docID ranges to ensure the new APIs are correctly decoding (and there is no possibility of segfault)
It tests all the bits (for loop on line 77), and sequential reads starting at index 0-31, and also the last 10000 docs. IMO it is quite thorough.
